subject: Cooking
title: Wonder Bread and the Rise of Industrial Baking
description: A micro-lesson that makes Wonder Bread and the Rise of Industrial Baking usable.

hook.text: In 1921, Wonder Bread promised something revolutionary: every slice exactly the same. Consistency was the product.

buildup.text: Pre-sliced bread (1928) and industrial baking transformed bread from a craft product to a factory commodity.

discovery.text: The Chorleywood process (1961) used high-speed mixing to make bread in 3.5 hours instead of overnight.

twist.text: Industrial bread contains emulsifiers, preservatives, and enzymes not required on labels ‚Äî the 'clean label' loophole.

climax.text: 80% of UK bread uses the Chorleywood process. Artisan bakeries fight back with time, not technology.

punchline.text: The greatest thing since sliced bread might be bread before it was sliced.

quiz.question: What did the Chorleywood process achieve in bread-making?
options: Bread production in 3.5 hours instead of overnight
